TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: qaruqaruman kata ḍail (Tjauvałi [or Tjavuałi] village, p.251)

S.FORM: izua qaruqaruman kata ḍail a mareqali.
izoa qaroqaroman kata drail a mareqali.
S.TRANSL: There were two friends, the ant-eater and the monkey.

S.FORM: aza ḍail: "ari kikasivi, qalian," ayain a qaruqaruman.
aza drail: "ari kikasivi, qalian," ayain a qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: The monkey said to the ant-eater: “Come on, friend, let’s go and collect wood.”

S.FORM: qau vaik a kikasiw.
qao vaik a kikasiw.
S.TRANSL: They went to collect wood.

S.FORM: qau matsaqu aravats a ḍail a kikasiw.
qao macaqo aravac a drail a kikasiw.
S.TRANSL: The monkey was very good at collecting wood;

S.FORM: aza qaruqaruman inika matsaqu a kikasiw.
aza qaroqaroman inika macaqo a kikasiw.
S.TRANSL: but the ant-eater wasn’t.

S.FORM: "tja kudain nu kikasiw itjen?" aya a qaruqaruman tua ḍail a kivadaq.
"tja kodain no kikasiw itjen?" aya a qaroqaroman toa drail a kivadaq.
S.TRANSL: “How do we collect wood?” the ant-eater asked the monkey.

S.FORM: "tja kiluḍayan, qau matsaqu itjen a kikasiw," ayain nua ḍail.
"tja kilodrayan, qao macaqo itjen a kikasiw," ayain noa drail.
S.TRANSL: “We roll around on it(?). Then we are good at collecting wood,” said the monkey.

S.FORM: qau kiluḍayan nua qaruqaruman a maka pavavaw a łaviavia.
qao kilodrayan noa qaroqaroman a maka pavavaw a ljaviavia.
S.TRANSL: So the ant-eater rolled around (on the wood (?)) on the grass.

S.FORM: inika putjaumał.
inika potjaomalj.
S.TRANSL: He didn’t follow instructions.

S.FORM: qau vaik i umaq tiamadju.
qao vaik i omaq tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: And they went home.

S.FORM: ka małia, "ari kigang itjen," aya a qaruqaruman tua ḍail.
ka maljia, "ari kigang itjen," aya a qaroqaroman toa drail.
S.TRANSL: Next day, “Come on, we’re going to collect crabs,” said the ant-eater to the monkey.

S.FORM: qau vaik a kigang.
qao vaik a kigang.
S.TRANSL: So they went to get crabs.

S.FORM: qau inika matsaqu a kigang a ḍail.
qao inika macaqo a kigang a drail.
S.TRANSL: The monkey wasn’t good at collecting crabs.

S.FORM: "tja kudain nu kigang itjen?" aya a ḍail a kivadaq tua qaruqaruman.
"tja kodain no kigang itjen?" aya a drail a kivadaq toa qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: “How do we collect crabs?” the monkey asked the ant-eater.

S.FORM: qau "tja tjuqtjuqen a tja lima," ayain nua qaruqaruman a tjemumał.
qao "tja tjoqtjoqen a tja lima," ayain noa qaroqaroman a tjemomalj.
S.TRANSL: “We hit our arms,” the ant-eater told the monkey.

S.FORM: qau tjuqtjuqen a lima nua ḍail.
qao tjoqtjoqen a lima noa drail.
S.TRANSL: The monkey hit his arms;

S.FORM: łakua saqetju sakamaya.
ljakoa saqetjo sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: but it only hurt.

S.FORM: inika matsaqu a kigang a ḍail.
inika macaqo a kigang a drail.
S.TRANSL: The monkey wasn’t any good at collecting crabs.

S.FORM: qau "temapi itjen tua vasa," aya tiamadju.
qao "temapi itjen toa vasa," aya tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: “We’ll cook some taro in an earth oven,” they said.

S.FORM: qau temapi; penułat a tinapi.
qao temapi; penoljat a tinapi.
S.TRANSL: So they made an earth-oven; all their taro was cooked (?).

S.FORM: "ari, mavanaw itjen a sema djanaw," aya.
"ari, mavanaw itjen a sema djanaw," aya.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, we’ll bathe in the pool,” they said.

S.FORM: vaik a mavanaw.
vaik a mavanaw.
S.TRANSL: They went to bathe.

S.FORM: qau "pare ledeledepi; tima a tsuatsuay?" aya tiamadju.
qao "pare ledeledepi; tima a coacoay?" aya tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: “Let’s both dive in, and see who can stay under longest,” they said.

S.FORM: "nu maitazua, tiakenay anan," aya a ḍail.
"no maitazoa, tiakenay anan," aya a drail.
S.TRANSL: “All right; I’ll go first,” said the monkey.

S.FORM: qau lemdep a ḍail.
qao lemdep a drail.
S.TRANSL: The monkey dived in;

S.FORM: inika tsuatsuay tjekatsauan.
inika coacoay tjekacaoan.
S.TRANSL: and quite soon came out again.

S.FORM: "tiakenay anga," aya qaruqaruman.
"tiakenay anga," aya qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: “Now me,” said the ant-eater.

S.FORM: qau lemdep a qaruqaruman.
qao lemdep a qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: The ant-eater dived in;

S.FORM: sa kemali a łetaladj tua qipu; padjałun tua tinapi niamadju.
sa kemali a ljetaladj toa qipo; padjaljon toa tinapi niamadjo.
S.TRANSL: and dug into the ground, and reached the taros they had cooked.

S.FORM: qau kanen a kuḍakuḍalan a tinapi.
qao kanen a kodrakodralan a tinapi.
S.TRANSL: He ate the big taros;

S.FORM: qau tjekatsauan a qaruqaruman.
qao tjekacaoan a qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: and then the ant-eater came out of the water.

S.FORM: qau "tja kanaw a tja tinapi," aya.
qao "tja kanaw a tja tinapi," aya.
S.TRANSL: “We’ll eat what we’ve cooked,” they said;

S.FORM: sutapian; qau nekanga a kuḍakuḍalan.
sotapian; qao nekanga a kodrakodralan.
S.TRANSL: and uncovered the earth-oven. There were no big taros.

S.FORM: qau kanen anga azua keḍikeḍian.
qao kanen anga azoa kedrikedrian.
S.TRANSL: So they just ate the small ones.

S.FORM: ka makakan, "putsaqi itjen, tuki tima kuḍakuḍal a tsaqi.
ka makakan, "pocaqi itjen, toki tima kodrakodral a caqi.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished eating the two of them said: “We’ll defecate, and see who has the bigger faeces.

S.FORM: azua tjakuḍal a tsaqi, avan nu nakeman tua tinapi a kuḍakuḍalan," aya tiamadju a maḍusa.
azoa tjakodral a caqi, avan no nakeman toa tinapi a kodrakodralan," aya tiamadjo a madrosa.
S.TRANSL: The one with the bigger faeces will be the one who has eaten the big cooked taros.”

S.FORM: qau putsaqi tiamadju.
qao pocaqi tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: They defecated,

S.FORM: tjakuḍal a tsaqi nua qaruqaruman.
tjakodral a caqi noa qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: and the ant-eater’s faeces was bigger.

S.FORM: qau vetseqelen a qaruqaruman nua ḍail.
qao veceqelen a qaroqaroman noa drail.
S.TRANSL: And the monkey strangled the ant-eater.

S.FORM: qau "pałałama-i," aya tiamadju a małavar.
qao "paljaljama-i," aya tiamadjo a maljavar.
S.TRANSL: “Let’s set fire to one another,” they decided.

S.FORM: qau "tiakenay isangas," aya ti qaruqaruman.
qao "tiakenay isangas," aya ti qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: “Me first,” said the ant-eater.

S.FORM: qau łamain ti qaruqaruman; inika matsay.
qao ljamain ti qaroqaroman; inika macay.
S.TRANSL: The (grass round the (OA)) ant-eater was set on fire; but he didn’t die.

S.FORM: "tiaken anga," aya a ḍail.
"tiaken anga," aya a drail.
S.TRANSL: “Now me,” said the monkey.

S.FORM: qau łevavaw ta kasiw.
qao ljevavaw ta kasiw.
S.TRANSL: He went up a tree.

S.FORM: ka łamain, matsay a ḍail.
ka ljamain, macay a drail.
S.TRANSL: When he/it was set on fire, the monkey died.

S.FORM: ka matsay a ḍail, kitjen a qalitsi nua ḍail; saka mevałut a ḍail.
ka macay a drail, kitjen a qalici noa drail; saka mevaljot a drail.
S.TRANSL: When the monkey had died, [the ant-eater] cut off the monkey’s penis. And the monkey came back to life.

S.FORM: sipakan ni qaruqaruman tua ḍail azua qalitsi.
sipakan ni qaroqaroman toa drail azoa qalici.
S.TRANSL: The ant-eater fed the penis to the monkey.

S.FORM: qau "kemakan ti ḍail tua qalitsi nimadju," semenasenay ti qaruqaruman.
qao "kemakan ti drail toa qalici nimadjo," semenasenay ti qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: And the ant-eater sang: “The monkey is eating his penis.”

S.FORM: "anemanema aya sun?" aya a ḍail.
"anemanema aya son?" aya a drail.
S.TRANSL: “What are you saying?” said the monkey.

S.FORM: "kidjavadjavay aken tua se Tjavaliłuk tua ku kinipangałan," aya ti qaruqaruman.
"kidjavadjavay aken toa se Tjavaliljok toa ko kinipangaljan," aya ti qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: “I’m thanking the Tjavaliłuk people for the share (of meat) they have given me,” said the ant-eater.

S.FORM: sauniuni "qau pai patsuni a nisun," ayain a ḍail nua qaruqaruman.
saonioni "qao pai paconi a nison," ayain a drail noa qaroqaroman.
S.TRANSL: Later the ant-eater said to the monkey: “Let’s look at your private parts.”

S.FORM: qau qayamen a nimadju na ḍail; nekanga a qalitsi; kinan anga a nimadju.
qao qayamen a nimadjo na drail; nekanga a qalici; kinan anga a nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: The monkey had a look, and he had no penis; it had been eaten.
